action.action-desc: Mrs. Miller-Meeks (for herself and Mr. Westerman) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Natural Resources

form.official-title: To amend the National Environmental Policy Act of 1969 to limit the scope of environmental reviews required by such Act, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Stay Off My Line Act.
Title I of the National Environmental Policy Act of 1969 (42 U.S.C. 4321 et seq.) is amended by adding at the end the following:

section.header: Application limited to Federal land and certain Federal actions

subsection.text: Under section 102(2)(C), the term ‘major Federal action’ does not include a project or action that—

paragraph.text: does not involve Federal land; and
is not subject to Federal control and responsibility.

subsection.text: A project or action may not be determined to be a major Federal action under section 102(2)(C) on the basis of—

paragraph.text: an interstate effect of such project or action; or
the provision of Federal funds for such project or activity.

subsection.text: The scope of any review under section 102 shall extend only to so much of a major Federal action as is—

paragraph.text: is subject to Federal control and responsibility.
